title: Coworking Days Return to Helsinki Education Hub This Spring
content:
tiffapog@helsinki.fi
Thu, 22/01/2026 - 15:35


                    
Helsinki Education Hub (HEH) is pleased to welcome back our monthly Coworking Days this spring, offering a shared space where edtech founders, researchers, and students can work side by side. Our aim is to bring together people working at the intersection of educational science and edtech development. (suomeksi alla)
Spring 2026 C
creator: tiffapog@helsinki.fi

title: Helsingin yliopiston sijoitustuotto kuusi prosenttia vuonna 2025
content:
ksalmiva@helsinki.fi
Thu, 22/01/2026 - 15:14


                    
The investments have returned more than 400 million Euros since 2019
University of Helsinki’s financial security investments returned 6.0 percent in 2025. Since the beginning of 2019, when the University adopted the current strategy, the investments have returned cumulatively 116.9 percent, or approximately 440 million Euros. The
creator: ksalmiva@helsinki.fi

title: Helsingin yliopiston kasvatustieteet 41. THE Rankingissa
content:
taalto@helsinki.fi
Thu, 22/01/2026 - 17:06


                    


  
The educational sciences improved their ranking from 50 to 41 in the discipline-specific annual Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings.
This marked rise is a very positive change after years of decline, bringing back educational sciences at the University of Helsinki to the global top 50. Among European universi
creator: taalto@helsinki.fi

title: Luonnontieteellinen museo suljetaan huoltoviikon ajaksi
content:
johanemi@helsinki.fi
Fri, 09/01/2026 - 14:10


                    
The museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January 2026. The doors will reopen on Saturday, 17 January.

The renovation is expected to be completed in late 2026.
The renovation will start with the construction of temporary traffic arrangements from Wednesday 7 January onwards. The renovation is expected to be completed in late 2026.

title: Kotina metsä -näyttely tuo luonnonmetsän keskelle Helsinkiä
content:
johanemi@helsinki.fi
Fri, 30/05/2025 - 14:09


                    
In Finland, natural forests have become a rarity – and for many, they remain unfamiliar. The Forest Home exhibition invites visitors to discover them through photography, video installations and scientific specimens. Forest Home is on display at the Natural History Museum until 5 April 2026.

title: Laajin tutkimus suomalaisnuorten ilmastoahdistuksesta: toivon ylläpitäminen avainasemassa
content:
uotinen@helsinki.fi
Fri, 23/01/2026 - 10:48


                    
Pro-environmental behaviour alone can increase young people’s climate change distress, as no single individual can solve climate change. Instead, adolescents’ hope and trust in the ability of communities to act should be boosted.
With her doctoral thesis,  aims to establish an in-depth and broad view of climate change distress amon
